sub_title: Sustainable Energy Solutions Developer | Shell | INSEAD | Stanford GSB | IITK
summary:
I am a driven professional with a strong foundation in both chemical engineering and mathematics, as well as a passion for data science and sustainability.

Throughout my career, I have held a variety of roles and responsibilities that have allowed me to apply my technical skills and knowledge to various industries and sectors. My journey began as a chemical engineering student, but my interest in math led me to take electives and intern at Shell as a reservoir engineer. After completing my degree, I joined Shell full-time and registered for a bachelor's in mathematics, using my learning to apply for data scientist roles.

Since then, I have excelled in various data science positions, including working on data reconciliation for a gas-to-liquid plant at Shell and supporting the statistics team in their multivariate statistics studies in Amsterdam. I have also had the opportunity to manage teams of contractors and data scientists, and to take on a role as a process development engineer, developing a decarbonisation road map for a Shell site. Currently, I am leading the demand optimisation work stream for an electrification project at Shell, which aims to improve operations and reduce carbon emissions at manufacturing sites.

Overall, my career has been marked by a strong commitment to electrification and sustainability, and I am grateful for the opportunities I have had to work on projects that align with my personal interests and goals. I am always looking for new challenges and ways to further develop my skills and knowledge, and I am excited to connect with like-minded professionals on LinkedIn.

profile_positions.description:
"What's in the Name?"
As a senior operations research scientist and technical lead for the demand control optimization workstream on a moonshot project, I lead a diverse natural team to optimize energy demand through innovative solutions. I apply my expertise in mathematical modeling to design, implement and evaluate algorithms to meet project objectives. I mentor junior team members, manage risks, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery. My role is critical in pushing the boundaries of innovation and technology to achieve our goals.
profile_positions.title: Senior Operations Research Scientist

profile_positions.description: As a part of the Decision Science team, this role provides an opportunity to use advanced mathematical and analytical methods to solve business problems. Currently exploring decarbonization of Shell assets using Electrification.
profile_positions.title: Operations Research Analyst

profile_positions.description: Supporting Shell Assets in Carbon abatement using electrification
profile_positions.title: Operations Researcher

profile_positions.description: Lead Data Scientist Supporting Digital transformation of two of the most important Shell sites in Singapore, building advanced analytics models to support quality operations and business.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Solving plant control system issues by reconciling sensor data using different methods. Building data science, monitoring, modeling and optimization tools for day-to-day for Shell's operating assets & projects. 
Focusing on how to combine data and insights from our operating assets and projects, and optimization methods to support most profitable decision making.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Researcher

profile_positions.description: Multivariate Statistical analysis to find out correlation between nature of trips and startups on deactivation of catalyst.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Plant-wide data reconciliation, diagnostics & prognostics for Gas-to-Liquid Fischer-Tropsch catalytic reactors at SMDS.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Part of Shell's long range research program focusing on transition to new and sustainable energy technologies. Test/develop Dualfoil code for simulating battery cycling & generate power density – energy density maps as function of cell architecture.
profile_positions.title: Researcher at R&D - Mathematics and Computing

profile_positions.description: Decline Curve analysis done on Baram Delta Fields, to forecast the production. DCA done for three different cases namely string level, group level and field level, defended the reliability on group level DCA rather than the other two extreme cases i.e. string lever and field level.
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Engineer

profile_positions.description: Bayesian Statistical analysis to determine the composition of glacier water in the main river stream as a part of four end members namely glacier, rain water, ground water and snow. Monte-Carlo simulation was used to build the model in MATLAB in the form of mixing system.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description: Production Forecast using analytical methods of water flooding for a field in Abu Dhabi. Three different analytical techniques were used namely Berkley Leverett, Dykstra Parson's and Stiles method. Dykstra Parson's was found to be the most effective technique for producing the forecast based on production history
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Engineering Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: We are a group of certified professionals supporting people with life coaching who are finding it difficult to deal with different situations in their lives and need help in sorting their thoughts. The idea is to ensure that mental health becomes a casual topic of consideration and people could feel free to come out and deal with the stress along with professional support.
Solving problems to optimise logistics and reduce emissions
I have mentored more than 50 professional in last one-year helping them find their ways through corporate careers.
